extract.html: A particle of mass m is in a 1-D infinite square well of width L (0<x<L). Stationary states have energies En = n²π²ħ²/(2mL²).

questions.prompt: Q1. State the boundary conditions for ψ(x) in an infinite square well.
Q2. For an electron (m=9.11e-31 kg) in L=1.0e-9 m, compute E1 in eV (ħ=1.055e-34 J·s, 1 eV=1.602e-19 J).
Q3. If n increases, how do energy spacings change?
